results.title: Suspected Metformin-induced Cobalamin Deficiency Mimicking Thrombotic Thrombocytopenic Purpura
results.text_hl: Our @SPECIES_9606 @@@patient@@@ was a 36-year-old female with @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus_Type_2 @DISEASE_MESH:D003924 @@@type 2 diabetes mellitus@@@ on @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ for eight years who presented with @<m>DISEASE_Anemia_Hemolytic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000743 @@@hemolytic anemia@@@, @DISEASE_Thrombocytopenia @DISEASE_MESH:D013921 @@@thrombocytopenia@@@, schistocytes and mild @DISEASE_Acute_Kidney_Injury @DISEASE_MESH:D058186 @@@acute renal failure@@@.

citations.NLM: Hussain SA, Ammad Ud Din M, Boppana LKT, Kapoor A, Jamshed S. Suspected Metformin-induced Cobalamin Deficiency Mimicking Thrombotic Thrombocytopenic Purpura Cureus. 2020 Feb 8;12(2):e6921. PMID: 32190475
citations.BibTeX: @article{32190475, title={Suspected Metformin-induced Cobalamin Deficiency Mimicking Thrombotic Thrombocytopenic Purpura}, author={Hussain SA and Ammad Ud Din M and Boppana LKT and Kapoor A and Jamshed S}, journal={Cureus}, volume={12}, number={2}, pages={e6921}}

results.title: Predictors of gastrointestinal complaints in patients on metformin therapy
results.text_hl: Also, other authors have so far not found a connection between @<m>DISEASE_Anemia_Hemolytic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000743 @@@anaemia@@@ and GI complaints due to @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@MTF@@@ use, which indicates that additional studies are necessary to confirm and explain this connection.

citations.NLM: Raičević B, Janković S. Predictors of gastrointestinal complaints in patients on metformin therapy Open Med (Wars). 2023;18(1):20230871. PMID: 38045859
citations.BibTeX: @article{38045859, title={Predictors of gastrointestinal complaints in patients on metformin therapy}, author={Raičević B and Janković S}, journal={Open Med (Wars)}, volume={18}, number={1}, pages={20230871}}

results.title: Serum vitamin B12, distal symmetrical polyneuropathy and anaemia in type 2 diabetes: the Fremantle Diabetes Study Phase 2.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ increased the likelihood of @<m>DISEASE_Anemia_Hemolytic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000743 @@@anaemia@@@, especially at high doses, independent of @DISEASE_Vitamin_B_12_Deficiency @DISEASE_MESH:D014806 @@@vitamin B12 deficiency@@@.

citations.NLM: Davis TME, Chubb SAP, Peters KE, Davis WA. Serum vitamin B12, distal symmetrical polyneuropathy and anaemia in type 2 diabetes: the Fremantle Diabetes Study Phase 2. Intern Med J. 2023 Sep 4;():. PMID: 37665691

results.title: Clinical Profile of Polycystic Ovarian Syndrome in Women From Bhimavaram: A Cross-Sectional Study.
results.text_hl: Therapeutic management included @CHEMICAL_Clomiphene @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002996 @@@clomiphene citrate@@@, hormonal contraceptives, and @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@. However, adherence remained a key challenge in achieving therapeutic success.

citations.NLM: Mavulati SC, Dodoala S. Clinical Profile of Polycystic Ovarian Syndrome in Women From Bhimavaram: A Cross-Sectional Study. Cureus. 2025 Apr;17(4):e81854. PMID: 40342475
citations.BibTeX: @article{40342475, title={Clinical Profile of Polycystic Ovarian Syndrome in Women From Bhimavaram: A Cross-Sectional Study.}, author={Mavulati SC and Dodoala S}, journal={Cureus}, volume={17}, number={4}, pages={e81854}}

results.title: Interventions for preventing the progression of autosomal dominant polycystic kidney disease.
results.text_hl: Somatostatin analogues probably increase @DISEASE_Alopecia @DISEASE_MESH:D000505 @@@alopecia@@@, @DISEASE_Diarrhea @DISEASE_MESH:D003967 @@@diarrhoea@@@ or @DISEASE_Abnormalities_Drug_Induced @DISEASE_MESH:D000014 @@@abnormal faeces@@@, @DISEASE_Dizziness @DISEASE_MESH:D004244 @@@dizziness@@@ and @DISEASE_Fatigue @DISEASE_MESH:D005221 @@@fatigue@@@ but may have little or no effect on @<m>DISEASE_Anemia_Hemolytic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000743 @@@anaemia@@@ or @DISEASE_Infections @DISEASE_MESH:D007239 @@@infection@@@.

citations.NLM: St Pierre K, Cashmore BA, Bolignano D, Zoccali C, Ruospo M, Craig JC, Strippoli GF, Mallett AJ, Green SC, Tunnicliffe DJ. Interventions for preventing the progression of autosomal dominant polycystic kidney disease. Cochrane Database Syst Rev. 2024 Oct 2;10(10):CD010294. PMID: 39356039

results.text_hl: Fatal @<m>DISEASE_Anemia_Hemolytic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000743 @@@hemolytic anemia@@@ associated with @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@: A case report

results.title: Metformin poisoning: A complex presentation
results.text_hl: ...@<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ impairs GI absorption of @CHEMICAL_Vitamin_B_12 @CHEMICAL_MESH:D014805 @@@vitamin B12@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Folic_Acid @CHEMICAL_MESH:D005492 @@@folic acid@@@, but acute onset of @<m>DISEASE_Anemia_Hemolytic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000743 @@@haemolytic anaemia@@@ is unlikely.
